snippet: As one British school seeks to boost the use of the Queen's English, local traditionalists grumble that proud regional dialects are under threat. In an increasingly standardized world, should we all learn to speak the same way?
abstract: As one British school seeks to boost the use of the Queen's English, local traditionalists grumble that proud regional dialects are under threat. In an increasingly standardized world, should we all learn to speak the same way?

headline.main: Calling Henry Higgins: School Makes a Case for Standard English
